But NOBODY answers the one question that needs to be answered. Who gave the orders in Iraq during the early days? Specifically, who gave Order number one and order number two which disbanded both the Baath Party and the army of Iraq? These orders killed thousands of our troops and hundreds of thousands of Iraqis. It'll just be another step in earning back everything I lost, he told the Pittsburgh Post-Gazette's Ron Cook last week. Enterprise Virtualization For six years, Larry Page and Sergey Brin told Eric Schmidt that Google should build its own browser, and for six years, he resisted. "Google was a small company," Eric Schmidt remembered. Having come through the bruising browser wars, I didn't want to do that again. So Sergey Brin and Page hired some ex-Firefox developers and had them build a prototype. When they showed Eric Schmidt the browser that would be Chrome, he relented.
